        protected void setHandlers()

      • delimitText

        protected static java.lang.Object delimitText(java.lang.Object object)
        Enclose database text string objects with a delimiter. The default delimiter is single quotes. If the text contains single quotes or a backslash then $$ is used instead, unless the text already contains $$ or ends with $, in which case $_$ is used as the delimiter
        Parameters:
        object - object to be stored in the database
        Returns:
        Object enclosed by delimiters if the object is a text string

      • buildTableDescription

        private java.lang.String buildTableDescription(java.lang.String tablePath,
                                               java.lang.String description)
        Build the specified table instance's description update command. The table's description is stored in the custom values table. Blank descriptions aren't stored
        Parameters:
        tablePath - path to the table. For a structure table the format is: rootTable,dataType0.variableName0[, dataType1.variableName1[,...[,dataTypeN,variableNameN]]]; the first data type/variable name pair is from the root table, with each succeeding pair coming from the next level down in the structure's hierarchy. The path is the same as the root table name for non-structure tables
        description - table description
        Returns:
        Command to update the specified table's description

      • buildColumnOrder

        private java.lang.String buildColumnOrder(java.lang.String tablePath,
                                          java.lang.String columnOrder)
        Build the specified table instance's column order update command
        Parameters:
        tablePath - path to the table. For a structure table the format is: rootTable,dataType0.variableName0[, dataType1.variableName1[,...[,dataTypeN,variableNameN]]]; the first data type/variable name pair is from the root table, with each succeeding pair coming from the next level down in the structure's hierarchy. The path is the same as the root table name for non-structure tables
        columnOrder - table column order
        Returns:
        Command to update the specified table's column order for the current user

                                                           java.awt.Component parent)
        Perform a query on the currently open database
        Parameters:
        sqlCommand - PostgreSQL-compatible database query statement
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        Two-dimensional array representing the rows and columns of data returned by the database query; returns null if the query produces an error, or an empty array if there are no results

      • createTableInBackground

        protected void createTableInBackground(java.lang.String[] tableNames,
                                       java.lang.String description,
                                       java.lang.String tableType,
                                       CcddTableManagerDialog tableDialog)
        Create one or more tables of the specified type. This command is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database command completes execution
        Parameters:
        tableNames - array of names of the tables to create
        description - description for the new table(s)
        tableType - type of table to create (e.g., Structure or Command)
        tableDialog - reference to the table manager dialog

                           java.lang.String newName,
                           java.lang.String newDescription,
                           CcddTableManagerDialog tableDialog)
        Change the name of a table. Only prototype tables can be renamed using this method (instances are renamed by changing the variable name in the prototype). This command is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database command completes execution
        Parameters:

        newName - new name for this table
        newDescription - new description for this table
        tableDialog - reference to the table manager dialog

      • loadTableDataInBackground

        protected javax.swing.SwingWorker<?,?> loadTableDataInBackground(java.lang.String tablePath,
                                                                 CcddTableEditorDialog currentEditorDlg)
        Load the contents of a single database table and display the data in a table editor. Do not load the table if it is already open for editing. If the table is already open, then the editor for this table is brought to the foreground. This command is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database command completes execution
        Parameters:
        tablePath - table path in the format rootTable[,dataType1.variable1[,dataType2 .variable2[,...]]]. The table path for a non-structure table is simply the root table name. For a structure table the root table is the top level structure table from which this table descends. The first data type/variable name pair is from the root table, with each succeeding pair coming from the next level down in the structure's hierarchy
        currentEditorDlg - editor dialog to open the table in; null to open the table in a new editor dialog
        Returns:
        SwingWorker reference for this thread

      • loadTableDataInBackground

        protected javax.swing.SwingWorker<?,?> loadTableDataInBackground(java.lang.String[] tablePaths,
                                                                 CcddTableEditorDialog callingEditorDlg)
        Load the contents of an array of database tables and display the data in a table editor. Do not load tables that are already open for editing. If no table is loaded, but one in the list is already open, then the editor for this table is brought to the foreground. This command is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database command completes execution
        Parameters:
        tablePaths - array of paths of the tables to load in the format rootTable[,dataType1.variable1[,dataType2 .variable2[,...]]]. The table path for a non-structure table is simply the root table name. For a structure table the root table is the top level structure table from which this table descends. The first data type/variable name pair is from the root table, with each succeeding pair coming from the next level down in the structure's hierarchy
        callingEditorDlg - table editor dialog in which to open the table; null to open the table in a new editor dialog
        Returns:
        SwingWorker reference for this thread

      • loadTableData

        protected CcddClassesDataTable.TableInformation loadTableData(java.lang.String tablePath,
                                                              boolean loadDescription,
                                                              boolean loadColumnOrder,
                                                              java.awt.Component parent)
        Perform the database query to load the contents of a database table. The data is sorted in ascending numerical order based on the index (primary key) column
        Parameters:
        tablePath - table path in the format rootTable[,dataType1.variable1[,dataType2 .variable2[,...]]]. The table path for a non-structure table is simply the root table name. For a structure table the root table is the top level structure table from which this table descends. The first data type/variable name pair is from the root table, with each succeeding pair coming from the next level down in the structure's hierarchy
        loadDescription - true to load the table's description
        loadColumnOrder - true to load the table's column order
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        TableInformation class containing the table data from the database. If the error flag is set the an error occurred and the data is invalid

      • loadTableMembers

        protected java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableMembers> loadTableMembers(CcddConstants.TableMemberType memberType,
                                                                             boolean sortByName,
                                                                             java.awt.Component parent)
        Create a list of all prototype tables with their child tables (prototypes and instances), and primitive variables (if specified). The table must contain all of the protected columns defined for a structure in order for its members to be determined. Non-structure tables are included in the returned list, but by definition have no members
        Parameters:
        memberType - Type of table members to load: TABLES_ONLY to exclude primitive variables or INCLUDE_PRIMITIVES to include tables and primitive variables
        sortByName - true to return the table members in alphabetical order (e.g., for use in a tree); false to return the members sorted by row index (e.g., for use in determining the variable offsets in the structure)
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        List containing the table member information. For structure tables the member tables are included, along with primitive variables (if specified), sorted by variable name or row index as specified

      • modifyTableDataInBackground

        protected void modifyTableDataInBackground(CcddClassesDataTable.TableInformation tableInfo,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableModification> additions,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableModification> modifications,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableModification> deletions,
                                           boolean forceUpdate,
                                           boolean skipInternalTables,
                                           boolean updateDescription,
                                           boolean updateColumnOrder,
                                           boolean updateFieldInfo,
                                           CcddDataTypeHandler newDataTypeHandler,
                                           java.awt.Component parent)
        Add, modify, and/or delete data in a table. This command is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database command completes execution
        Parameters:
        tableInfo - table information
        additions - list of row addition information
        modifications - list of row update information
        deletions - list of row deletion information
        forceUpdate - true to make the changes to other tables; false to only make changes to tables other than the one in which the changes originally took place
        skipInternalTables - true to not build and execute the commands to update the internal tables. This is used during a data type update where only the data type name has changed in order to speed up the operation
        updateDescription - true to update the table description from the table information; false to not change the table description
        updateColumnOrder - true to update the table column order from the table information; false to not change the table column order
        updateFieldInfo - true to update the table data fields from the table information; false to not change the table data fields
        newDataTypeHandler - data type handler with data type modifications. null (or a reference to the current data type handler) if the change does not originate from the data type editor
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

        Update the link definitions when a string variable's size is increased (i.e., a new member is added to the array)
        Parameters:
        protoTable - prototype table name to which the string variable belongs
        dataType - string variable's data type name
        variableName - string variable's name

      • deleteLinkPathRef

        private void deleteLinkPathRef(java.lang.String linksPath,
                               java.lang.StringBuilder linksCmd)
        Build the command to delete the specified table/variable references from the links table
        Parameters:
        linksPath - table/variable path to remove from the links table. Leading or trailing regular expression constructs must surround the path, and any reserved PostgreSQL characters in the path must be escaped
        linksCmd - StringBuilder containing the existing links table deletion command. If empty then a new command is initiated; otherwise the deletions are appended to the existing command

      • deleteTlmPathRef

                              java.lang.StringBuilder tlmCmd)

        Parameters:

        tlmCmd - StringBuilder containing the existing telemetry scheduler table deletion command. If empty then a new command is initiated; otherwise the deletions are appended to the existing command

        variableName - variable name

        variablePathEsc - variable path with any PostgreSQL reserved characters escaped so that the path can be used in a regular expression

        tlmDelCmd - StringBuilder containing the existing telemetry scheduler table deletion command

      • modifyTableTypeInBackground

        protected void modifyTableTypeInBackground(java.lang.String tableType,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.FieldInformation> fieldInformation,
                                           CcddConstants.OverwriteFieldValueType overwriteFields,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> typeAdditions,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> typeModifications,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> typeDeletions,
                                           boolean columnOrderChange,
                                           CcddTableTypeHandler.TypeDefinition originalDefn,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableModification> fieldAdditions,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableModification> fieldModifications,
                                           java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.TableModification> fieldDeletions,
                                           CcddTableTypeEditorDialog editorDialog,
                                           CcddTableTypeEditorHandler editor)
        Add, rename, or delete table type column names in the table definitions table and update the existing tables of the specified type. This command is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the database command completes execution
        Parameters:
        tableType - table type name to modify
        fieldInformation - data field information list
        overwriteFields - OverwriteFieldValueType: ALL to overwrite all field values, SAME to overwrite only those fields with a matching value, EMPTY to overwrite only fields with blank values, or NONE to not overwrite any field values
        typeAdditions - list of new columns to add to the tables. Each list item is an array containing: [0] column name (user), [1] column input type
        typeModifications - list of name changes of existing columns in the tables. Each list item is an array containing: [0] original column name (user), [1] new column name (user), [2] column input type
        typeDeletions - list of columns to remove from the tables. Each list item is an array containing: [0] column name (user), [1] column input type
        columnOrderChange - true if the table type's column order changed
        originalDefn - reference to the table type definition prior to making any changes
        fieldAdditions - list of new fields to add to tables of this type
        fieldModifications - list of changes to existing fields in tables of this type
        fieldDeletions - list of fields to remove from tables of this type
        editorDialog - reference to the table type editor dialog
        editor - reference to the table type editor where the change(s) occurred

      • getPrototypeTablesOfType

        protected java.lang.String[] getPrototypeTablesOfType(java.lang.String tableType)
        Get an array containing all prototype tables that are of the specified table type (combining all structure and all command tables)
        Parameters:
        tableType - TYPE_STRUCTURE to get all tables for any type that represents a structure, TYPE_COMMAND to get all tables for any type that represents a command, TYPE_OTHER to get all tables that are neither a structure or command table, or the table type name to get all tables for the specified type
        Returns:
        Array containing all prototype tables that represent the specified type. Returns an empty array if no table of the specified type exists in the project database
